inference:
$$\text{Area of }\triangle ABC=\frac{1}{2}BD\cdot DC=\frac{1}{2}(5)(9)=\frac{45}{2}$$

$$\text{Area of }\triangle ABC=\frac{1}{2}BE\cdot EC=\frac{1}{2}BE\cdot 42/5=\frac{21BE}{5}$$

$$\frac{45}{2}=\frac{21BE}{5}\Rightarrow BE=\frac{10\cdot45}{42}=\frac{50}{3}$$

$$HE=\frac{BE\cdot CE}{EC}=\frac{\left(\frac{50}{3}\right)\left(\frac{42}{5}\right)}{\frac{42}{5}}=\frac{50\cdot42}{3\cdot42}=\frac{50}{3}$$

$$\boxed{ \text{Final Answer:}  \frac{50}{3}  }$$
ground_truth:
By Pythagoras, $BE^2 = BC^2 - CE^2 = 14^2 - (42/5)^2 = 3136/25$, so $BE = \sqrt{3136/25} = 56/5$.

Triangles $BDH$ and $BEC$ are right, and share $\angle HBD$, so they are similar.  Hence, \[\frac{BH}{BD} = \frac{BC}{BE},\]so \[BH = \frac{BC}{BE} \cdot BD = \frac{14}{56/5} \cdot 5 = \frac{25}{4}.\]Then $HE = BE - BH = 56/5 - 25/4 = \boxed{\frac{99}{20}}$.

$$\text{Area of }\triangle ABC=\frac{1}{2}BE\cdot EC=\frac{1}{2}BE\cdot 42/5=\frac{21BE}{5}$$

$$\frac{45}{2}=\frac{21BE}{5}\Rightarrow BE=\frac{10\cdot45}{42}=\frac{50}{3}$$

$$HE=\frac{BE\cdot CE}{EC}=\frac{\left(\frac{50}{3}\right)\left(\frac{42}{5}\right)}{\frac{42}{5}}=\frac{50\cdot42}{3\cdot42}=\frac{50}{3}$$

$$\boxed{ \text{Final Answer:}  \frac{50}{3}  }$$

By Pythagoras, $BE^2 = BC^2 - CE^2 = 14^2 - (42/5)^2 = 3136/25$, so $BE = \sqrt{3136/25} = 56/5$.

Triangles $BDH$ and $BEC$ are right, and share $\angle HBD$, so they are similar.  Hence, \[\frac{BH}{BD} = \frac{BC}{BE},\]so \[BH = \frac{BC}{BE} \cdot BD = \frac{14}{56/5} \cdot 5 = \frac{25}{4}.\]Then $HE = BE - BH = 56/5 - 25/4 = \boxed{\frac{99}{20}}$.
